Posted By: SoulShatterer (6/30/2010 10:56:29 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
[Painter's Servant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Painter's Servant) turns all your permanents white, including lands. If you have nothing but a [Painter's Servant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Painter's Servant), this, and the four lands it took to play it, this guy is a 6/6 with vigilance. Chances are it'll get much bigger.  
  
Other than that, this card doesn't have much of a reason to exist outside of a deck with a lot of little creatures.
posts.html:

Other than that, this card doesn't have much of a reason to exist outside of a deck with a lot of little creatures.

Posted By: Bibblesbun (1/22/2009 3:28:04 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@ alblast: wrong. painter's servant makes lands any colored permanent you want...  
andd, i agree with medomai - this belongs in weenie and/or swarm decks. you'd just need to throw some extra things in, like maybe some [Heaven's Gate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Heaven's Gate)s (so you don't have to make the deck JUST white), a few [Brave the elements](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brave the elements), or maybe even one or two [Pennon Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pennon Blade)s...

Posted By: EnderofGames (9/20/2011 2:43:15 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This was the card that taught my friends and I that lands were colorless, when we first started.
  
We were pretty tired of facing this guy as a 7/7 by the turn he dropped. (If 1 land and 1 white permanent was dropped each turn, realistically one of them dying.)
